revised_title: Rapid Force-Flux Transitions in Highly Porous Membranes: A Quantitative Study
tldr: This study investigates rapid force-flux transitions in highly porous membranes, focusing on Nuclepore filters with uniform circular and parallel pores. The authors develop a quantitative theory that considers the membrane pores as independent capillaries lined with an electrical double layer and a diffuse counter charge in the pore solution. They analyze the pressure-driven and electro-osmotic flows and predict the observed types of transitions in fluxes and forces, providing a general understanding of the system's behavior. The study also presents a membrane cell design for testing the theory and compares observed and predicted current-voltage curves.
